pages.title: Grants Program HQ

content.text: : Review period concludes; approved projects can kickstart their missions!

pages.contentText: Welcome to the Grants Program! 📅 Key Dates:Nov 6, 2023: Wave 1 applications open.Nov 27, 2023: Deadline for Wave 1 applications.Dec 8, 2023: Review period concludes; approved projects can kickstart their missions!Jan 31, 2024: Wave 1 wraps up.Click LOG IN [<- add invite link here] to join the spaceWelcome to the Grants Program[Briefly describe your program here]About GrantsApplySupport

children.title: Grants Council

content.text: to help streamline and enhance the efficiency and consistency of the application process for
population of enthusiastic and talented value-aligned builders
. The Grants program should support developers launching novel applications that will draw new users and maintain
Attract exceptional community members into the Grants program, individuals who share our goals and mission. This, in turn, will draw the most dedicated contributors to enrich the ecosystem.
Develop a more streamlined and consistent process, with structure and standard operating procedure for reviewing grants, and perform interviews, where appropriate, with grant applicants.
Streamline the process and manage payments for approved proposals.
Collaborate with proposers to ensure that proposed project milestones are clearly defined, measurable, and achievable within the specified timeframe.
Provide post-grant support to project teams by facilitating connections with core contributors to offer the right support and marketing efforts.
[List Council members here and provide contact info]
community members will be empowered to join the Grants Council

children.contentText: The Grants Council's role is to help streamline and enhance the efficiency and consistency of the application process for grant proposers.MissionThe Grants Program's mission is to:Grow the population of enthusiastic and talented value-aligned builders in the ecosystem. The Grants program should support developers launching novel applications that will draw new users and maintain our long-term growth.Attract exceptional community members into the Grants program, individuals who share our goals and mission. This, in turn, will draw the most dedicated contributors to enrich the ecosystem.Grants Council responsibilities:Develop a more streamlined and consistent process, with structure and standard operating procedure for reviewing grants, and perform interviews, where appropriate, with grant applicants.Streamline the process and manage payments for approved proposals.Collaborate with proposers to ensure that proposed project milestones are clearly defined, measurable, and achievable within the specified timeframe.Provide post-grant support to project teams by facilitating connections with core contributors to offer the right support and marketing efforts.StructureThe Grants Council consists of four members responsible for reviewing proposals across all funding categories.[List Council members here and provide contact info]Member 1, Title, ContactMember 2, Title, ContactAdditional detailsIn future iterations, the intention is for additional community members will be empowered to join the Grants Council through community-based elections.

children.contentText: Approval ProcessPhase 1 (Filtering): Applications submitted on CharmVerse will be reviewed and discussed by the Grants Council. Phase 2 (Refinement): Within 7 days of receiving the application, the Grants Council will provide feedback to proposers and follow-up with questions and/or request a call.  Applicants will have the opportunity to incorporate feedback from the Grants Council to refine their grant applications. Phase 3 (Final Decision): At the end of the application window, the Grants Council will review and discuss refined proposals on a Weekly Sync. The Grants Council will carry out an internal vote to approve/reject each application. The Grants Council's final decision will be publicly announced, and approved applications can now get to work on their project!During the review period, if one of the Grants Council members believes that a certain proposal may benefit from wider community approval, the Grants Council may seek community consensus via  Snapshot vote. Grantee Milestones and GuidelinesInitial grant proposals should prioritize milestones achievable within a 2-3 month timeframe.As part of their application, each grant proposer is expected to assess how their project's roadmap aligns with and enhances the ecosystem.Grant applicants are required to outline a set of milestones by which the Community and the Grants Council can judge the progress of the proposer’s project.As part of their application, each grant proposer is expected to describe the expected timeline for overall grant completion.Milestones are critical in establishing consensus between the grant proposer, the Grants Council, and the community. They serve as specific benchmarks that showcase genuine commitment to achieving the proposed project objectives.The Grants Council will collaborate directly with successful grant proposers to define milestones that will determine the overall success of each project.Each successful proposer must establish completion of each milestone deliverable within the defined grant scope.Milestone payments will be disbursed upon the successful completion of each milestone.Payment AdministrationCurrency: All transactions are done in USDC.Administration: Handled by the Grants Council via the Grants Program multisig.Milestone-based Payments: Payments are released upon milestone completion.

children.title: Request for Grants

content.text: The mission of the Grants Program is to increase the adoption of long-term contributors and developers building novel applications.
represent specific challenges and needs that we are actively looking to fund. This approach will ensure that G
allocates grants to projects that align
Contributors can apply to receive between $5k to $50k of funding per grant for any of the categories.
Support the development of tools that simplify and enhance the experience for developers building in our ecosystem.
Tools that improve the developer experience building on our framework
Frameworks that make it easy to develop applications on our framework
Testing and debugging frameworks that help developers to test and debug their applications.
Monitoring and analytics tools that help developers to monitor and analyze the performance of their applications.
Promote the development of games that encourage growth and onboarding on
Games that highlight the capabilities of
Infrastructure and tooling that simplifies game development on
Open-source games that can be reused/built upon by other developers.

The Grants Council will use the Rubric below to grade proposals during Phase 1 of the application filtering process. To arrive at a final decision, the Grants Council will evaluate each proposal and come to a consensus through an internal vote.
[Share your rubric with the community here. You could add an image or modify the table below]
Team expertise, domain alignment, technical understanding + critical skills
Likelihood the project has immediate/long-term chances of success and can generate value
Grant size is proportional to the benefit or expected outcome
Whether milestones hold grantees accountable + if they are trackable
Novel use of technology used or is it copy paste
Whether the project has some tangible use of web3 technology and would lead to broad adoption of web3 technology
This application form is included here for reference but applications should be created and submitted here:

What is the size of your grant request?
How do you justify the size of the request?

Tell us your implementation plan for your project. Clearly define the milestones you expect to achieve in order to receive milestone-based installments.
[Provide a detailed description of tasks related to this milestone.]
[Provide a detailed description of tasks related to this milestone.]

How are you planning to build or improve our ecosystem?
Try to detail out the plan to leverage our framework and tech.
Why will this solution be a source of growth for the ecosystem?
Does your project solve a problem for the ecosystem?

children.contentText: Wave 1 Mission and AllotmentThe mission of the Grants Program is to increase the adoption of long-term contributors and developers building novel applications.For Wave 1, the Grants Council has allotted up to $500k in USDC, to be distributed across 4 areas of focus that represent specific challenges and needs that we are actively looking to fund. This approach will ensure that Grants Program allocates grants to projects that align with the ecosystem's priorities.Areas of FocusContributors can apply to receive between $5k to $50k of funding per grant for any of the categories. 1️⃣  Decentralized ApplicationsTotal Allocation: $150,000Objective: Fund projects that leverage our frameworks to create innovative dApps valuable to the broader ecosystem.Expected Deliverables: Creation and deployment of dApps.2️⃣  IntegrationsTotal Allocation: $100,000Objective: Fund solutions that integrate our technology with other innovative technologies.Expected Deliverables: Projects that integrate our technology with other innovative technologies.3️⃣  Developer ToolingTotal Allocation: $100,000Objective: Support the development of tools that simplify and enhance the experience for developers building in our ecosystem.Expected Deliverables:Tools that improve the developer experience building on our frameworkFrameworks that make it easy to develop applications on our frameworkTesting and debugging frameworks that help developers to test and debug their applications.Monitoring and analytics tools that help developers to monitor and analyze the performance of their applications.4️⃣  GamingTotal Allocation: $150,000Objective: Promote the development of games that encourage growth and onboarding on our chain. Expected Deliverables:Games that highlight the capabilities of our tech.Infrastructure and tooling that simplifies game development on our framework.Open-source games that can be reused/built upon by other developers.Evaluation RubricThe Grants Council will use the Rubric below to grade proposals during Phase 1 of the application filtering process. To arrive at a final decision, the Grants Council will evaluate each proposal and come to a consensus through an internal vote. [Share your rubric with the community here. You could add an image or modify the table below]ScoreDescription12345TeamTeam expertise, domain alignment, technical understanding + critical skillsLikelihood of successLikelihood the project has immediate/long-term chances of success and can generate value for the ecosystemGrant sizeGrant size is proportional to the benefit or expected outcomeMilestone assessmentWhether milestones hold grantees accountable + if they are trackableExperimentation + NoveltyNovel use of technology used or is it copy pasteTangible Use-cases for Web3 TechnologyWhether the project has some tangible use of web3 technology and would lead to broad adoption of web3 technologyRelationshipWhether the project is exclusively committed to our smart contractsDemo included (binary yes/no)No demo/poor demo vs high-quality demo includedDiscretionally factors (comments required)Application FormThis application form is included here for reference but applications should be created and submitted here: Section 1: Basic DetailsWhat grant type are you applying for?Decentralized Applications IntegrationsDeveloper ToolingGamingProject name:Author name and contact information:ERC-20 Payee address (to receive grant):What is the size of your grant request?How do you justify the size of the request?I understand that I will be expected to provide follow-up grant reporting information to the Grants Council and Cartesi Forum.YesNoSection 2: Project detailsIn a sentence, what are you going to build?Please describe in more depth here:Please provide us with any links to any of the following for the project:Link to product demo:Link to website:Link to Github:Link to Twitter:Other:What factors contribute to the potential success of your project?Does your project use any novel technology?What are some competing alternatives to what you are going to build? Is there any previous work you’ll be building on?Will your project be open-source?YesNoSection 3: TeamName and role of team member(s):Link to any previous work the team has contributed to:Tell us about your team’s strengths and qualifications that make you well-suited for this project:Section 4: Roadmap and Milestones:Tell us about your product development journey. Be sure to describe your product development to date (if any).Tell us your implementation plan for your project. Clearly define the milestones you expect to achieve in order to receive milestone-based installments.Milestone 1: [Milestone Name]Deliverables: [List key deliverables for this milestone.]Tasks: [Provide a detailed description of tasks related to this milestone.]Duration: [x weeks/months]Funding Expectation: [$x USD]	Milestone 2: [Milestone Name]Deliverables: [List key deliverables for this milestone.]Tasks: [Provide a detailed description of tasks related to this milestone.]Duration: [x weeks/months]Funding Expectation: [$x USD]What is your estimated timeline for completion of the project?Section 5: RelationshipHow are you planning to build or improve our ecosystem?Try to detail out the plan to leverage our framework and tech.Why will this solution be a source of growth for the ecosystem?Does your project solve a problem for the ecosystem?

children.contentText: Welcome to the Application page. Please apply prior to the Wave 1 deadline of November 27th  in order to have your proposal considered during the Grants Review decision cycle. ❗ Note: You must LOG IN [<- add invite link here] as a CharmVerse member (not a guest) to be able to submit applications. 👀 How to Apply 👀 Log-in to CharmVerse by clicking "LOG IN" on the Grants home page:  Go to "Applications" by clicking "Applications" under "Apply" on the home page.Click the 🔽  on the "Create" button on the Applications page.Choose the proposal template for the area of focus of your project.Title your application and complete the form in the body of the page.Save your application by clicking [Save draft]. You may continue to edit your application.To submit your application, click [Publish].Best PracticesTry to fill in all sections as best as you can. If you have questions, visit

children.title: Support + FAQs

content.text: For any assistance and inquiries, please use
[if your program uses Discord, add invite to your discord server here]
[Add link to a CharmVerse Forum category here]
What are the different application stages in the Grants Program?
erse will be reviewed and discussed by the Grants Council.
Within 7 days of receiving the application, the Grants Council will provide feedback
and follow up with questions and/or request a call. Applicants
have the opportunity to incorporate feedback from the Grants
At the end of the application window, the Grants Council
carried out by the Grants Council to approve/reject
The Grant Council's final decision will be publicly announced,
Once the Grants Council vote passes,
can now get to work on their project!
Are startups or new ventures eligible for grants?
Absolutely! As long as the project aligns with
mission and the specified criteria. Projects aiming to be open source or public goods are especially encouraged.
After submitting my proposal, what can I expect?
Your proposal enters a feedback loop where both the community and the Grants Council offer suggestions and insights. It's crucial to be responsive during this phase.
How many grants are typically awarded in each category?
There isn't a fixed number. It's based on the quality and relevance of applications received.
Can I communicate directly with a Grants Council member?
We encourage initial interactions through our community channels.
How should I determine the grant amount to request?
Request what aligns with your project's needs, keeping in mind
mission and the potential impact. Remember to be realistic and justified in your ask.
For the current wave, the Grants Program isn't focused on retroactive grants.
Do I need a specific blockchain address for proposal submission?
For grant payouts, ensure you provide an Ethereum Mainnet-compatible address.
How are the milestones and payouts correlated?
Payments are predominantly milestone-driven. Successful completion of each milestone, as outlined in your proposal, triggers the corresponding payout.
If I encounter issues or need clarity during the application process, what should I do?
Feel free to reach out via the community channels provided above. We're here to guide and assist.

children.contentText: Get in touchFor any assistance and inquiries, please use Discord or Forum.Discord: [if your program uses Discord, add invite to your discord server here]Forum: [Add link to a CharmVerse Forum category here]Frequently Asked QuestionsWhat are the different application stages in the Grants Program?Phase 1 (Filtering): Applications submitted on CharmVerse will be reviewed and discussed by the Grants Council.Phase 2 (Refinement): Within 7 days of receiving the application, the Grants Council will provide feedback to proposers and follow up with questions and/or request a call. Applicants will have the opportunity to incorporate feedback from the Grants Council to refine their grant applications. Phase 3 (Final Decision): At the end of the application window, the Grants Council will review and discuss refined proposals on a CGP Weekly Sync. An internal vote will be carried out by the Grants Council to approve/reject each application. The Grant Council's final decision will be publicly announced, Once the Grants Council vote passes, and approved applications can now get to work on their project! Are startups or new ventures eligible for grants?Absolutely! As long as the project aligns with the mission and the specified criteria. Projects aiming to be open source or public goods are especially encouraged. After submitting my proposal, what can I expect? Your proposal enters a feedback loop where both the community and the Grants Council offer suggestions and insights. It's crucial to be responsive during this phase. How many grants are typically awarded in each category? There isn't a fixed number. It's based on the quality and relevance of applications received. Can I communicate directly with a Grants Council member? We encourage initial interactions through our community channels.How should I determine the grant amount to request? Request what aligns with your project's needs, keeping in mind our mission and the potential impact. Remember to be realistic and justified in your ask. 	Are there retroactive grants? For the current wave, the Grants Program isn't focused on retroactive grants.	Do I need a specific blockchain address for proposal submission? For grant payouts, ensure you provide an Ethereum Mainnet-compatible address.	How are the milestones and payouts correlated? Payments are predominantly milestone-driven. Successful completion of each milestone, as outlined in your proposal, triggers the corresponding payout. 	If I encounter issues or need clarity during the application process, what should I do?Feel free to reach out via the community channels provided above. We're here to guide and assist.

This page is only 👀 visible to admins and members with the Grants Council role.This database serves as a collaborative hub for the Grants Council, providing a private space for making notes and conducting discussions among its members.🔍 Preliminary review: add a new column as a Select Property to mark applications as either Pass or Fail. Provide a quick overview of which proposals move to the next stage.🗒️ At a glance Notes: add another column for notes, allowing notes to be easily visible within the database view.

How are you planning to build or improve our ecosystem?
Try to detail out the plan to leverage our framework and tech.
Why will this solution be a source of growth for the ecosystem?
Does your project solve a problem for the ecosystem?

pages.title: About this template

content.text: We created this template for your community. Below is a summary of the starting settings that come along with the
template. You can easily change the setup or further customize this space for your community by clicking and exploring
VISIBLE in the side nav bar:
Every member that joins your space will receive the Default role. A default member will have:
Until changed by an Admin, a member with the Default role will be able to:
Create a post in any forum category
custom roles to get you started but feel free to create more or import from Discord, CollabLand, or Guild.
Assign this role to a member to help moderate your space. In addition to default permissions, a user with the Moderator role will be able to:
Moderate and access all Forum categories
The Grants Council role has FULL ACCESS to
page contains an inline database with Applications (Proposals) set as the source.
This database serves as a collaborative hub for the Grants Council, providing a private space for making notes and conducting discussions among its members.
role is assigned as the Reviewer in all of the preset
In addition to default permissions, a user with the Grants Council role will be able to:
The Applicant role has the same permissions as the Default role. A user with the Applicant role will be able to:
Create a post in any forum category
A member is required to select a template when creating an application.

Two custom properties have been added to the Member Directory. Initially, your members will be asked but not required to fill out these properties when joining your space.  If you would like to make a property required, click the
in the upper right-hand corner of the Member Directory page, select the property, and check the REQUIRED box.
This is a single-line text property, visible by everyone in the space in all views.
This is an email property, visible only to admins and
the Governance Council role in the table view.

pages.contentText: Attention, Admins! We created this template for your community. Below is a summary of the starting settings that come along with the Grantor template. You can easily change the setup or further customize this space for your community by clicking and exploring ⚙️ Settings in the side bar.⭐ Feature Custom Names and VisibilityAll 4 features are 👀 VISIBLE in the side nav bar: Member DirectoryProposals renamed as ApplicationsForumRewards renamed as Milestones📫 NotificationsIn-app notifications are ENABLED for:✅ Rewards (Milestones)✅ Proposals (Applications)✅ Polls👤 Default Role PermissionsEvery member that joins your space will receive the Default role. A default member will have:👀 VIEW only access to    and subpages except for  🙈 No access to  Until changed by an Admin, a member with the Default role will be able to:Create a proposal (an application) in any proposal categoryCreate a post in any forum category🎩 Custom RolesHere are a few custom roles to get you started but feel free to create more or import from Discord, CollabLand, or Guild.ModeratorAssign this role to a member to help moderate your space. In addition to default permissions, a user with the Moderator role will be able to:Create new pagesDelete any pageCreate new rewards (milestones)Delete any rewardDelete and archive any proposal (application)Moderate and access all Forum categoriesGrants CouncilThe Grants Council role has FULL ACCESS to  and subpages including  .The Application Review page contains an inline database with Applications (Proposals) set as the source. This database serves as a collaborative hub for the Grants Council, providing a private space for making notes and conducting discussions among its members.The Grants Council role is assigned as the Reviewer in all of the preset application (proposal) templates. In addition to default permissions, a user with the Grants Council role will be able to:Create new pagesCreate new rewards (milestones)Review proposals (applications)ApplicantThe Applicant role has the same permissions as the Default role. A user with the Applicant role will be able to:Create a proposal (an application) in any proposal categoryCreate a post in any forum category📝 Proposal (Application) TemplatesA member is required to select a template when creating an application.You will start with these 4 templates:IntegrationsDappsDev ToolingGaming💬 Forum CategoriesYou will start with these 4 forum categories:AnnouncementsGeneralIntroductionsSupport & Feedback👥 Member Directory Custom PropertiesTwo custom properties have been added to the Member Directory. Initially, your members will be asked but not required to fill out these properties when joining your space.  If you would like to make a property required, click the ... in the upper right-hand corner of the Member Directory page, select the property, and check the REQUIRED box.Project NameThis is a single-line text property, visible by everyone in the space in all views.Primary EmailThis is an email property, visible only to admins and members with the Governance Council role in the table view.

posts.title: Get the conversation started!

content.text: It is easy to start a conversation here, in CharmVerse! Simply click
from the dropdown menu. Make sure to title your post because you won't be able to publish it without one.
When creating a post, you have access to most of the CharmEditor's cool features.
text to style, format, or add a link
to bring up a menu of available blocks. Insert an image or video, embed a tweet or NFT, and more.
-mention a member, role, or even a page to add a useful link
It is also easy to join a conversation! Reply or add your thoughts below a post. The
comments will be threaded and easy to follow. And if you think a post is really amazing, don't forget to upvote

posts.contentText: 👋 Welcome to your CharmVerse Forum!It is easy to start a conversation here, in CharmVerse! Simply click [Create Post] and choose a Category from the dropdown menu. Make sure to title your post because you won't be able to publish it without one.When creating a post, you have access to most of the CharmEditor's cool features.Highlight text to style, format, or add a linkType / to bring up a menu of available blocks. Insert an image or video, embed a tweet or NFT, and more.@-mention a member, role, or even a page to add a useful linkIt is also easy to join a conversation! Reply or add your thoughts below a post. The 💬 comments will be threaded and easy to follow. And if you think a post is really amazing, don't forget to upvote ⬆️ .
